jurisdictions.name: City & County of Honolulu
jurisdictions.notes: Expedited permitting for qualifying PV systems up to 20 kW. HECO (Hawaiian Electric Company) interconnection. High solar penetration area -- interconnection studies sometimes required. 25-year property tax exemption. Hurricane wind load requirements (105-130 mph).

jurisdictions.name: County of Maui
jurisdictions.notes: MECO (Maui Electric Company) interconnection. Grid saturation may cause delays. Battery storage strongly recommended. Hurricane wind load requirements apply. Post-fire rebuilding areas may have expedited solar permitting.

jurisdictions.name: County of Hawaii (Big Island)
jurisdictions.notes: HELCO (Hawaii Electric Light Company) interconnection. Lava zones and flood zones may affect installations. Off-grid systems common in some areas. Multiple climate zones from tropical coast to alpine summit.

jurisdictions.name: County of Kauai
jurisdictions.notes: KIUC (Kauai Island Utility Cooperative) provides interconnection -- separate from HECO. KIUC has different net metering and export policies. Battery storage highly recommended due to grid saturation. Hurricane wind load requirements.

state_level_requirements.contractor_license_type: C-60 Solar Energy Contractor license or General Contractor license (B classification includes solar). Licensed electrician required for electrical work.
state_level_requirements.net_metering_details: Hawaii ended traditional net metering in 2015. Replaced with Customer Grid-Supply (CGS) and Customer Self-Supply (CSS) programs. Smart Export program pays time-varying export rates (approximately 10-15 cents/kWh). Battery storage strongly incentivized for self-consumption. HECO, MECO, HELCO handle interconnection on most islands. KIUC (Kauai) operates independently. $25 minimum monthly grid connection bill.
state_level_requirements.solar_access_details: HRS 196-7 prohibits preventing solar installation on single-family dwellings or townhouses. One of the earliest and strongest solar access laws in the nation.
state_level_requirements.solarapp_details: No statewide SolarAPP+ program. Hawaii Renewable Energy Permitting Wizard available at portal.ehawaii.gov. Honolulu offers expedited permitting for systems up to 20 kW.
state_level_requirements.state_incentive_program: 25-year property tax exemption (Honolulu); no state sales tax (general excise tax exemption for solar); Smart Export time-varying rates; 100% renewable energy mandate by 2045; highest electricity rates in US ($0.35-0.45/kWh) make solar very attractive; battery storage incentives
